wiki.article.standard.town.title: Town
wiki.article.standard.town.text: Town is the main good faction. Usually, the majority of the players in each game are townies. They don't start knowing who each other are, unlike the mafia or the cult. Town wins by eliminating all opposing teams (mafia, cult, arsonist, werewolf, etc). The townies need to work together to find out who the evils are. Their main power is in communication and voting, so if you are a townie who does not communicate, you are not helping your team win.
wiki.article.standard.mafia.title: Mafia
wiki.article.standard.mafia.text: The Mafia is the main evil faction. There are fewer mafia members than townies, but they know who each other are. The mafia wins by eliminating all opposing teams. The mafia kills and lies to get people to execute innocent townies in order to get rid of the town. The mafia can communicate at night to create strategies and help each other lie. Most mafia roles can't select each other to use their ability. The mafia always has a godfather who attacks someone each night. If the godfather dies, a new mafia member becomes the godfather.
wiki.article.standard.neutral.title: Neutral
wiki.article.standard.neutral.text: Neutrals are not all on the same team. Each neutral role has special win conditions. Most of them are against both the town and the mafia. Some neutral roles can win before the game ends like the Jester, Revolutionary, and Doomsayer.
wiki.article.standard.fiends.title: Fiends
wiki.article.standard.fiends.text: Fiends win by eliminating all opposing teams. Fiends are on the same team, but they can't communicate at night. Fiends are usually very powerful and can kill multiple players in one night. Unlike mafia and cult, most games should have at most one fiend, in addition to the town and mafia.
wiki.article.standard.cult.title: Cult
wiki.article.standard.cult.text:
Cult is an evil faction. They win by eliminating all opposing teams, they can communicate at night, and they know who each other are. The cult as a whole has 2 abilities, kill and convert. They alternate, converting first, and killing after.
- The cult can only kill after they have successfully converted someone, after that, they can only convert after successfully killing someone. If for some reason the ability doesn't work (Protection or Roleblock), then it is tried again the next night. It is not inherently every other night.

- Apostle. If there is a cult, there is always an apostle. The apostle uses their ability to convert players. If there is no zealot, then the apostle kills.
- Disciple. The disciple has no ability.
- Zealot. The zealot is always be the role of the newest created cultist member. The zealot will do the kills instead of the apostle if a zealot exits.
wiki.article.standard.tag.title: Tag
wiki.article.standard.tag.text: Tags are icons shown next to player names in the player menu. Tags can be added or removed by some roles. Tags can show information like who the godfathers backup is, who is the Revolutionary target, who the moritician has tagged, etc. Players are told when they gain and lose tags on other players.
wiki.article.standard.reveal.title: Reveal
wiki.article.standard.reveal.text:
- When a player is revealed to you, you can see their role label, and you are given a message saying their role
- When a player is concealed from you, you lose their role label, and are given a chat message saying they are concealed form you
    - A player gets concealed when they die or switch roles.

 Revealing and role labels are private. so if you see a role label, others might not also see that role label. Mafia members are always revealed to each other while alive
wiki.article.standard.roleLabel.title: Role Label
wiki.article.standard.roleLabel.text:
- Role labels appear next to player names, it shows what role that player is
- Role labels are not always public, for example, you can see your own role label at all times, but other players can not
- A mafia member can see the other mafia members role labels
- When you gain a role label on another player, you get a chat message saying that players role was revealed to you
- When you lose a role label on another player, you get a chat message saying that players role was concealed from you
- If a player that is revealed to you switches roles or dies, their role label will be concealed
- Dead players can not have role labels, the role that appears next to their name is just the role on their grave. These can be inaccurate for reasons like the mortician or forger's ability
wiki.article.standard.interview.title: Interview
wiki.article.standard.interview.text: A journalist can interview a player during the night, allowing the journalist to speak with them. The player being interviewed may not know who the journalist is, but everyone knows the journalist is on the town team.
wiki.article.standard.journal.title: Journal
wiki.article.standard.journal.text: The journalist has a journal which is posted publicly every obituary the journalist chooses to. Everyone knows the journal was written by the journalist so they know the information is trustworthy. The journalist may interview a player each night to gain information to include in the journal.
wiki.article.standard.forged.title: Forged
wiki.article.standard.forged.text: A player who is forged had their alibi and role changed by the forger on their grave.
wiki.article.standard.fullMoon.title: Full Moon
wiki.article.standard.fullMoon.text: Every night is a full moon night except night one and night three. The Werewolf has a different ability depending on whether or not it is a full moon night.
wiki.article.standard.vision.title: Vision
wiki.article.standard.vision.text: Visions are the investigative result that a Psychic receives. Good visions show a list of 2 players that contains at least one townie. Evil visions show a list of three players that contains at least one non-townie. An Aura can effect a psychic vision. A player with a suspicious aura will not show up in a good vision, and a player with an innocent aura will not show up in an evil vision.
wiki.article.standard.select.title: Select
wiki.article.standard.select.text: Selecting is when you click the button under a player at night in order to attempt to use your ability on them. Selecting determines who you will visit before it becomes affected by other effects. By default, you can select a number of players up to as many targets as your role can have. Most roles can not select themselves or dead players, and some roles have further restrictions on selections. Most mafia members and cultists can not select other players on their team.
wiki.article.standard.visit.title: Visit
wiki.article.standard.visit.text:
Usually, visits are decided by selecting players. Visits are what actually causes active abilities to work. _For example_: A Detective could select a player, but a Witch could possess them to make them visit someone else, and then the Detective will unknowingly get their results from the player that they visited instead of the player they selected.

 An attacking visit is a visit that attempts to kill a player. Some roles like Ojo, Bodyguard, and Engineer work differently if a visit is an attacking visit.
wiki.article.standard.target.title: Target
wiki.article.standard.target.text: Your target is the player who you visit.
wiki.article.standard.indirect.title: Indirect
wiki.article.standard.indirect.text:
An indirect ability is one that does not visit. Therefore, it is unable to be seen by a lookout or tracker or affected by many other abilities._For Example_:
- If a marksman attacks a player with the engineers trap on them, as long as the marksman does not visit the trapped player, the trap isn't set off, even when the marked player is attacked. This is because the attack is indirect.
wiki.article.standard.hypnotize.title: Hypnotize
wiki.article.standard.hypnotize.text: A player who is hypnotized was a hypnotists target.
wiki.article.standard.frame.title: Frame
wiki.article.standard.frame.text: A player who is framed was a framers target.
wiki.article.standard.convert.title: Convert
wiki.article.standard.convert.text:
A player's role is changed. All of their ability uses are refilled to maximum. _For Example:_
- If someone is converted to a Veteran, they get all three ability uses.
- An Apostle can convert players into cultists.
wiki.article.standard.roleblock.title: Roleblock
wiki.article.standard.roleblock.text: A player who is roleblocked has their visits erased. A player's visits being erased often means they can't use their ability. Some roles are immune or not affected by being roleblocked. Escort and Hypnotist are roles that can roleblock other players and are both immune to being roleblocked.
wiki.article.standard.ward.title: Ward
wiki.article.standard.ward.text:
Someone can be warded. Anyone who visits a player who is warded has all their visits erased and receives a chat message saying that they are wardblocked. _For Example_:
- A bouncer selects a player to ward each night
- The jailor puts a player in jail, warding them.

 Some roles are wardblock immune
- A jester can kill someone even if they're warded
wiki.article.standard.block.title: Block
wiki.article.standard.block.text: A player who is blocked was either roleblocked, wardblocked, or both. A player isn't blocked if they're immune
wiki.article.standard.jail.title: Jail
wiki.article.standard.jail.text: A Jailor can put a player in jail. When a player is in jail, they can talk with the Jailor at night, the Jailor can choose to execute them, they can't select anyone. The jailed player is warded, so most abilities acting on them fail, meaning their safe from most attacks or investigations.
wiki.article.standard.rampage.title: Rampage
wiki.article.standard.rampage.text: All visitors to a rampaged player are indirectly attacked. The rampage shares the attack level of the rampaging character.
wiki.article.standard.possess.title: Possess
wiki.article.standard.possess.text:
A player who is possessed was forced into visiting someone.
- Roles like Minion, and Retributionist, have the ability to possess players
- Some roles are immune to being possessed, like minion, and retributionist
- If a role visits multiple people, only the first visit is changed when possessed
- You can't be possessed into someone if your role doesn't allow you to select them. If a medium is possessed, they still don't visit anyone

__For Example__:

@1 the vigilante selects @7 in hopes of shooting them.
When night ends @1 gets a message saying they were possessed.
The next obituary, they see that @2 was shot instead.
This is because @4 is the minion, who possessed @1 into shooting @2.

__For Example__:

The philosopher selects @8 and @12, but they are possessed into @15
The philosopher actually visited @15 and @12, only the first visit was changed
wiki.article.standard.defense.title: Defense
wiki.article.standard.defense.text:
Attacks and defense have 3 tiers each. An attack can either be basic, armor-piercing, or protection-piercing.

A defense can either be armored, protected, or invincible.

A basic attack can not kill a player who is armored, and an armor-piercing attack can not kill a player who is protected. A protection-piercing attack can overpower armor as well as protection.

 Some roles have armor by default, usually evil ones. Protection can be granted to players through abilities like the Doctor's ability to protect their target. A player with invincible defense can only die by getting executed or leaving the game.

Unless otherwise indicated, attacks are basic by default and will not be able to kill players who are armored or protected. Indirect is not a tier of attack.
wiki.article.standard.protect.title: Protect
wiki.article.standard.protect.text: Protect means to increase someone's defense to protected. The protection will only last the night unless otherwise indicated. A protected player is told when they are attacked but saved by protection
wiki.article.standard.dead.title: Dead
wiki.article.standard.dead.text: If a player is dead, they can't vote, their grave will likely be in the graveyard, and they usually can't use their ability anymore. Dead players can only speak with other dead players with the exception of the Medium and its target. A player needs to die to become dead. All players start the game alive! (What did you expect‚Ä¶)
wiki.article.standard.silenced.title: Silenced
wiki.article.standard.silenced.text:
A player who is silenced can not talk or otherwise communicate during that day.
- They can't nominate during the nomination phase because they are forced to forfeit their vote
- They can still vote during the judgement phase
- If the silenced player is put on trial, they still can't talk
- If the players are talking out loud, silenced players should not speak or use any type of communication, including signals or facial expressions. The rule is, of a player can't use chat, they are not allowed to communicate
- Roles like deputy mayor and jailor can still use their abilities normally during the day even if silenced

 A Blackmailer can silence a player each night.
wiki.article.standard.friends.title: Friends
wiki.article.standard.friends.text:
If 2 players can win the same game, they are friends.
 - A jester can win in the same game as a detective, so they are friends
- An Apostle can win in the same game as a disciple so they are friends
- A godfather can't win in the same game as a detective, they both need the other to lose, so they are enemies
- A marionette is friends with a puppeteer and enemies with a medium
 The philosopher, detective, and gossip, can use their abilities to see if people are friends or enemies, although auras can effect these results.
wiki.article.standard.enemies.title: Enemies
wiki.article.standard.enemies.text:
If 2 players need the other to lose in order for themselves to win, they are enemies.
- A Politician can't win alongside a mayor, so they are enemies.
- A godfather can't win in the same game as a jailor, so they are enemies.
- A jester can win in the same game as a detective, so they are friends.
- An Apostle can't win with a godfather, so they are enemies.

 The philosopher, detective, and gossip, can use their abilities to see if people are friends or enemies, although auras can effect these results.
wiki.article.standard.haunt.title: Haunt
wiki.article.standard.haunt.text: After they die, a Medium can haunt a living player to allow them to communicate with the dead during the night. The haunted player is added to the dead chat group at night. If multiple mediums haunt multiple players, they can all speak with each other and all dead players.
wiki.article.standard.transport.title: Transport
wiki.article.standard.transport.text:
A transporter can transport players.
2 players who are transported with each other will have all of their visitors swapped. So if a Detective goes to visit a player who's transported with another player, then the Detective will actually visit the other player.
wiki.article.standard.innocent.title: Innocent
wiki.article.standard.innocent.text:
Innocent has multiple meanings.
- A result the Detective can get usually indicating the player they visited is a townie.
- Voting for someone to not be executed during judgement phase. If there are more guilty votes than innocent ones, the player on trial is executed.
wiki.article.standard.suspicious.title: Suspicious
wiki.article.standard.suspicious.text: A result the Detective can get usually indicating the player they visited is evil.
wiki.article.standard.guilty.title: Guilty
wiki.article.standard.guilty.text: A guilty vote during the judgement phase is a vote for the player on trial to be executed. If there are more Guilty votes than Innocent votes, the player on trial is executed.
wiki.article.standard.abstain.title: Abstain
wiki.article.standard.abstain.text: Abstaining is when a player does not vote during a Judgment phase. If all players Abstain, then the player on trial is not executed.
wiki.article.standard.obscured.title: Obscured
wiki.article.standard.obscured.text: A player who is obscured had their role and alibi erased from the graveyard. A Mortician can tag players for obscuring, then when they die, they are obscured.
wiki.article.standard.evil.title: Evil
wiki.article.standard.evil.text: If a role is evil, it means a role is non-town. A psychic can receive evil visions to learn who is not on town. A detective will see someone as suspicious if they are evil or have a suspicious aura.
wiki.article.standard.roleLimit.title: Role Limit
wiki.article.standard.roleLimit.text:
A roles limit is the maximum number of that role that can be generated at the start of a regular game. If there is no limit, there can be any number of that role.
- Veteran has a role limit of 1, there can only be one veteran, if 2 people claim veteran, one must be lying
- Wildcard must adhere to role limit
wiki.article.standard.douse.title: Douse
wiki.article.standard.douse.text: Arsonists can douse players, then later ignite, to attack everyone who is doused. If there is an arsonist alive then doused players have a suspicious aura. Igniting is an indirect, protection-piercing attack to all doused players.
wiki.article.standard.backup.title: Backup
wiki.article.standard.backup.text: The Godfather can choose another mafia member to be their backup at any time. If the Godfather is roleblocked or in jail, the backup will attack their selection instead.
wiki.article.standard.marionette.title: Marionette
wiki.article.standard.marionette.text:
A player who is a marionette has joined a different team
- They keep their old role when they become a marionette
- They are attacked every night by the role that recruited them with a protection piercing attack(EX. Recruiter or Puppeteer)
- If there are no players with the role that recruited them, the marionette is still attacked
- The marionette no longer wins with their original team but wins with the new team instead
wiki.article.standard.aura.title: Aura
wiki.article.standard.aura.text:
Players can have an aura that change how they appear to investigative roles.
- A player with a suspicious aura is:
    - Suspicious to a Detective
    - Enemies with everyone to the philosopher
    - Never in the psychics good vision
    - Enemies with your target to the gossip
    - Never a townie to the snoop
- A player with an innocent aura is:
    - Innocent to the detective
    - Friends with everyone to the philosopher
    - Friends with your target to the gossip
    - Never in the psychics evil vision

 Some roles have an aura by default
_For Example_
- The godfather has an innocent aura by default
- The werewolf has an innocent aura on some nights

 If a player has both an innocent and suspicious aura at the same time, the suspicious aura *usually* overrides.
- The detective sees them as suspicious
- The philosopher sees them as enemies
- The psychic can't see them in any vision
- They can't register to the snoop
- They are enemies with your target to the gossip
wiki.article.standard.appearedVisit.text:
A player could _appear_ to have visited someone, even though they didn't. This is usually caused by evil roles such as Framer.

This only affects investigative roles.

_Examples_

The Tracker and Lookout can see the appeared visit, but not the real visit.

A Veteran doesn't attack a player who appeared to visit them and didn't actually visit them.
wiki.article.standard.roleOutline.title: Role Outline
wiki.article.standard.roleOutline.text:
A role outline defines a group of roles.

Outlines can either be a predefined role set, an exact role, or a union of multiple.

_Examples_

"Any" It could be any role

"Neutral" Could be any possible neutral role.

"Town Support" Could be an Escort, Retributionist, Transporter, or Medium

"Godfather" Could only be a Godfather.

"Wildcard ‚à™ Psychic" Could either be an Wildcard or Psychic.

- When roles are generated randomly from a role outline, each possible role is equally likely to generate.
- Role outlines are used in the outline list to show what roles could be in the game.
wiki.article.standard.outlineList.title: Outline List
wiki.article.standard.outlineList.text: The outline list defines what roles are in the game. At the start of a game, each player gets assigned to a role outline. Then, their role is generated randomly from that role outline.
wiki.article.standard.chatGroup.title: Chat Group
wiki.article.standard.chatGroup.text:
All messages are either private or sent one of these chat groups
 - All üîä (The icon doesn't display next to messages, You are allowed to speak out loud if you can send to "All" chat) 
 - Dead üíÄ
 - Mafia üåπ
 - Cult üïØÔ∏è
 - Jail üîí
 - Interview üìù

 Players can be in multiple chat groups at once, or even read chat groups they are not in.
 - üîá Means you are not in the "All" chat group and are *not allowed to speak out loud*
 - üîÆ means that a living player sent a message to the dead chat group
 - ‚úâÔ∏è means that the message was sent privately
wiki.article.standard.fastForward.title: Fast Forward
wiki.article.standard.fastForward.text: If all living players vote to fast forward, the current phase instantly ends. Voting to fast forward is completely anonymous, nobody even knows when you press the button. To vote to fast forward, press the fast forward button in the top left.
wiki.article.standard.forfeitVote.title: Forfeit Vote
wiki.article.standard.forfeitVote.text:
Forfeiting your vote means you are not able to vote during the nomination phase but you can still vote during the judgement phase. During discussion, players can choose to forfeit their vote using the button at the top of the playerlist. Once Nomination starts, they can't change their mind.
- Everyone learns who forfeited their vote when nomination starts in the form of a tag
- For each player who forfeits their vote, the amount of votes needed for a trial decreases accordingly
- Players who are silenced are forced to forfeit their vote

 It is strongly recommended to never ever forfeit your vote unless you are silenced or pretending to be silenced
wiki.article.standard.loveLinked.title: Love Linked
wiki.article.standard.loveLinked.text: 2 players who are love linked are told who each other are. If one dies, the other dies of a broken heart. Cupid and Eros can love link players. So can the love link game modifier.
wiki.article.standard.howToPlay.title: How To Play
wiki.article.standard.howToPlay.text:
The goal of the game depends on your role. Most roles win if all players from opposing teams are eliminated
The teams are Town, Mafia, Cult, Fiends
- Town should try to find out who the mafia is in order to vote them out
- Mafia, cult, and fiends, should try to stay hidden while killing townies

The game runs in phases of day and night
- During night, each player uses their roles abilities
- During the day, players discuss information they learned and vote on a player to kill

There are subphases within day and night

# Night
Most role abilities work at night. Here are some examples
- Each night, the godfather can select a player to kill them
- Each night, the detective can select a player. The detective is told if the player they select is innocent or suspicious. This would help the detective find out who the mafia is. If they are suspicious they are not a townie
- Each night, the framer can select a player to make them register falsely to the detective. So a townie could register as suspicious to a detective falsely if a framer used their ability

# Obituary
During the obituary phase, everyone is told who died, along with the role and alibi of those who died.
All players should keep their alibi note page to keep track of all the information they learned during the game. The obituary phase is a perfect time to write down in your alibi what you learned last night. For example:

- If you're a detective who learned that @5 is suspicious on night 1. You could write your alibi to look like this

Detective
Night 1: @5 - suspicious

It is also important for non townie players to keep a fake alibi to pretend that they are a townie

# Discussion
The discussion phase is where players discuss the information they learned and try to find out who the mafia, fiends, and cult are
Players will ask each other to claim, this means they want to know the information that the other player learned
Most players send their alibi in chat during this phase, to share the information efficiently in response to being asked to claim. It will likely be considered suspicious to not have an alibi prepared when asked for one. So its very important to have one prepared, no matter who you are

# Nomination
During nomination, players can vote other players on to trial in order to execute them
The best way for townies to kill mafia members is to use their vote, even if you aren‚Äôt certain someone is evil, voting them onto trial and threatening them will often give information to help find mafia
- If more than half of the living players vote for one player, that player is put on trial
- If there aren‚Äôt enough votes in time, the game skips directly to dusk

# Testimony
- The player voted on trail is the only player allowed to speak and chat during this phase, they should certainly claim, send their alibi and say what their role is

# Judgement
- Everyone votes innocent or guilty (or abstains)
- If more players vote guilty than innocent, the player on trial will be executed
- If the player on trial isn‚Äôt executed, there is another trail (with a max of three)

# Final words
- The player who was on trial should be allowed to say some final words or notes they have for the town

# Dusk
- A prenight phase for everyone to get a last word in before the next night

# Final thoughts
The game runs in this loop until there is one team remaining
The encyclopedia has a list of all roles and their abilities. It is recommended to read up on your role during the beginning briefing phase
If your evil, you should try to learn how at least one townie role works so you can pretend to be that role
Neutral roles all have different win conditions and are not on a team. For example: Jester wins if they are voted out during a trail
wiki.article.standard.priority.title: Priority
wiki.article.standard.priority.text:
***Some information in this article may be old, or incorrect***

Abilities are used in a specific order called priority order. If 2 players have abilities that go on the same priority, the player with the lower player number will go first. It is recommended that you read a roles encyclopedia page before this page. Some abilities go before night starts. Attacking someone doesn't kill them until the end of the night. Here are all the priorities and the abilities that happen in them.

**Before Night (Not a priority)**

- Jailor chooses who to jail
- Journalist chooses who to interview
- Spy finds if an apostle can convert
- Death kills everyone
- Create Visits
  - All visits are decided by who is selected by each players. During each priority, each associated ability is activated using who is being visited by who, which is not necessarily who the player selected (in the case of a transporter, witch, etc...).

**1: Top Priority**

- Ojo (Visit every player with certain role)
- Doomsayer (Kill)
- Revolutionary (Suicide)
- Jester (Haunt)
- Veteran (Decide to Rampage)
- Vigilante (Suicide)

**2: Transporter**

- Transporter (Swap Visits)

**3: Possess**

- Witch (Possess)

**4: Necromancy**

- Retributionist (Possess/Change Visits)
- Necromancer (Possess/Change Visits)

**5: roleblock**

- Bouncer (roleblock)
- Hypnotist (roleblock)
- Escort (roleblock)
- Jailor (Invisible roleblock)

**6: Deception**

- Hypnotist (Hypnotize)
- Framer (Frame)
- Blackmailer (Silence)
- Mortician (Tag)
- Arsonist (Douse)

**7: Bodyguard**

- Bodyguard (Change visits)

**8: Heal**

- Engineer (Intentionally dismantle, set, or use trap)
- Bodyguard (Defend themselves)
- Sentinel (Protect target)
- Guardian (Defend)
- Veteran (Defend themselves)

**9: Kill**

- Ojo (Kill)
- Apostle (Kill)
- Zealot (Kill)
- Martyr (Kill)
- Engineer (Indirect Kill)
- Arsonist (Ignite)
- Bodyguard (Attack attacker)
- Sentinel (Attack Visitor)
- Godfather (Attack or Make Backup Attack)
- Jailor (Attack)
- Mafioso (Attack)
- Veteran (Rampage)
- Vigilante (Attack)
- Werewolf (Rampage and attacks)

**10: Investigative**

- Ojo (See)
- Journalist (Add Journal Message)
- Psychic (Vision)
- Engineer (Traps report info)
- Engineer (Dismantle if triggered) 
- Arsonist (Find who is doused)
- Bodyguard (Find if protected)
- Informant (Investigate)
- Sentinel (Find if protected)
- Death (Collect souls)
- Guardian (Find if protected)
- Mortician (Find role and alibi)
- Forger (Find role and alibi)
- Lookout (Investigate)
- Philosopher (Investigate)
- Detective (Investigate)
- Spy (Find who the Mafia Visits)
- Tracker (Investigate)
- Werewolf (Track players scent)

**11: Spy Bug**

- Spy (Bug)

**12: Steal Messages**

- Witch (Get target messages)
- Necromancer (Get target messages)
- Retributionist (Get target messages)

**13: Convert**

- Apostle (Convert)

**14: SpyCultistCount**

- Spy (Get Cult Count)
wiki.article.standard.chat.title: Chat
wiki.article.standard.chat.text:
The chat is where players receive most information.
- When night ends, the chat will show if you were attacked, roleblocked, transported and much more.
- Usually, players can't send messages at night, but some roles can.
- Not all messages can be seen by everyone, normal messages have icons that represent what chat group the message was sent in.
wiki.article.standard.playerList.title: Players
wiki.article.standard.playerList.text:
The players menu shows a list of all players in the game.
- This is where you go to select a player to use your ability or vote them. When it is possible to select or vote a player, a button appears.
- Click on a players name to prepend a whisper command to the chat box.
- Next to players names, you can see if they are dead, and potentially see their role label.
- Press the filter button to only see messages that include that players name.
- Some roles will display some information at the top of the player list
wiki.article.standard.alibi.title: Alibi
wiki.article.standard.alibi.text:
In order to find out who the mafia is, townies need to share information they have in order to deduce who is lying about their role. This is done with the use of alibis, which are records of the abilities you have used and information you have gathered. Alibis are posted in the chat and graveyard when the player dies. Here is an example of a typical alibi that a Detective would have.

> Detective
Night 1: Deodat Lawson - Innocent
Night 2: Samuel Parris - Suspicious

When the Detective posts this alibi in chat, they provide evidence to other players that on the second night, they found Samuel Parris as suspicious, implying that Samuel Parris is a mafia member. If the town believes the Detective, they will likely vote the suspicious player out.

For a mafia member to pretend to be a town role, they need to write a fake alibi to blend in with the town roles. _IF A PLAYER DOES NOT HAVE AN ALIBI, THEY ARE LIKELY A MAFIA MEMBER_ who doesn't know how to write a fake alibi, and they should be directed to this page.
wiki.article.standard.graveyard.title: Graveyard
wiki.article.standard.graveyard.text:
The graveyard can help keep track of what roles are in the game and who has them
- The outline list on the left shows what roles can be in the game
    - Click on an outline to cross it out to help keep track of what roles people are.
- The graves on the right show who is dead
   - If you click on a grave, you can see what their alibi and role was, as well as other related information
wiki.article.standard.modifiers.title: Modifiers
wiki.article.standard.modifiers.text: A game modifier is a setting set before the game that changes the game somehow. Some examples are the obscured graves modifier and the random love links modifier.
wiki.article.standard.obscuredGraves.tex: Obscured Graves is a game modifier that makes it so all graves are obscured.
wiki.article.standard.randomLoveLinks.te: Random Love Links is a game modifier that makes it so all players are love linked to a random player. The game is set up such that all players are love linked to at least 1 other player, and at most 1 player is love linked to more than 1 other player.
wiki.article.standard.deadCanChat.title: Dead Can Chat
wiki.article.standard.deadCanChat.text: Dead Can Chat is a game modifier that changes the game such that dead players can still use chats as if they were alive. Dead players can not whisper or be whispered to.
wiki.article.standard.noAbstaining.title: No Abstaining
wiki.article.standard.noAbstaining.text: No Abstaining is a game modifier that changes the game such that no players can abstain during judgement. It will default to voting innocent instead of defaulting to abstaining.
wiki.article.standard.noDeathCause.title: No Death Cause
wiki.article.standard.noDeathCause.text: No Death Cause is a game modifier that changes the game such that every grave says that the cause of death is execution.
wiki.article.standard.nobody.title: Nobody
wiki.article.standard.nobody.text: Nobody means nobody. If you have further questions, please contact us.
wiki.article.standard.vfr.title: Vote-For-Role
wiki.article.standard.vfr.text: Vote for role is the name of a common strategy. Players will choose a player and force them to claim under the threat of getting voted out. If that player claims they will likely be spared. Usually there is not much of a reason why a specific player is chosen, the strategy is often used to just get starting information.
wiki.article.standard.claim.title: Claim
wiki.article.standard.claim.text: When a player asks you to claim. They are likely asking you to say what your role is, and send your alibi in chat. This is not necessarily because they think your evil, but they want information from you.
wiki.article.standard.claimswap.title: Claim swap
wiki.article.standard.claimswap.text: When 2 players do a claim swap, they are both claiming each others roles. John Proctor is claiming engineer even though Deodat Lawson is engineer, and Deodat Lawson is claiming detective even thought John Proctor is detective. This is in order to hide information from evil players while still giving information to town. A doomsayer or kira can easily kill alot of townies if they know the exact roles of townies. Claim swap might help a veteran kill evil players.
wiki.article.standard.shwompt.title: Shwompt
wiki.article.standard.shwompt.text:
Shwompt 
Pronunciation:  Éw…ímpt 
A sudden whooshing sound that contains a siblant conclusion. This describes the sound that is made when objects phase through a solid wall. 
Other forms: Shwompter, Shwompting, Shwompted, Shwomptee
wiki.article.generated.roleSet.title: Role Set
wiki.article.generated.all_text.title: All text
wiki.article.role:
# \0 ### \1
### Guide \2 ### Abilities \3 ### Attributes \4 ### Extra \5
### Role Limit: \6 ### Defense: \7
### Keywords \8
wiki.article.role.noGuide: There is no guide section written for this page.
wiki.article.role.noAbilities: There is no abilities section written for this page.
wiki.article.role.noAttributes: There is no attributes section written for this page.
wiki.article.role.noExtra: There is no extras section written for this page.
wiki.article.role.jailor.guide:
- Each day, choose a player to jail. At night, you interrogate them in text chat
- You can kill your prisoner up to three times
- You can talk to your prisoner during the night, and they are not told who you are
- If you kill a townie, you lose the ability to kill your prisoner
- The players you jail are warded and roleblocked.
wiki.article.role.jailor.abilities:
* Choose one player to jail during the day
* Visit your prisoner to attack them
wiki.article.role.jailor.attributes:
* You may talk with your prisoner at night in jail chat
* If you kill a player who exclusively wins with town, you forfeit the ability to execute prisoners
* Players in jail are warded and roleblocked, they also can't select anybody
wiki.article.role.jailor.extra:
* The Jailor can not kill someone on night one
* If you kill a townie, or run out of kills, you can not select to kill anymore
* You invisibly roleblock the player you put in jail, they aren't told their roleblocked
* Players in jail don't see your name on your messages. The messages you send appear to be from the jailor
* If you jail a cult or mafia member, their teammates know that that player is in jail
wiki.article.role.villager.guide: You have no nighttime ability, but you can still speak and vote. Try to help find out who is evil and vote them. Your only ability is your own critical thinking.
wiki.article.role.mayor.guide:
Choose to enfranchise during the day to make your vote count as three votes for the rest of the game.
- When you enfranchise
    - Everyone is told you are the mayor
    - You can't whisper or be whispered to
    - You have triple voting power every day
wiki.article.role.mayor.abilities: * Enfranchise during the day to triple your voting power, revealing to everyone that you are the Mayor
wiki.article.role.mayor.attributes:
* You get 3 votes during both nomination and judgement after you enfranchise
* After you enfranchise you can't whisper or be whispered to
wiki.article.role.mayor.extra:
* If you are converted to a different role, players will still see that you are the mayor
* Enfranchising does not increase the number of votes required to put someone on trial
wiki.article.role.transporter.guide:
- At night, select 2 players
    - If somebody else tries to visit the first player, they will instead visit the second player, and vice versa

 _For example_
- If a godfather tries to attack @1, but you transported @1 and @4, then @4 will die instead

Its often a good strategy to transport innocent looking players with suspicious looking ones to divert a potential attack from the innocent player onto the suspicious player.
wiki.article.role.transporter.attributes:
* All visits to first player instead visit the second player
* All visits to the second player instead visit first player
* The players you visit get a message saying that they were transported
wiki.article.role.transporter.extra:
* Some abilities are not affected by yours due to the priority system. _For example_ You can't stop a jester from haunting their target using a transport, this depends on priorities and whether or not an ability is indirect
* A transporters visits can not be changed by another transporter
wiki.article.role.detective.guide:
- At night, select a player to find if they're innocent or suspicious
- If a player registers as suspicious, they are enemies with town. You most likely want them voted out.
- Auras can mess with your results
    - Godfathers have innocent aura
wiki.article.role.detective.abilities: * Visit a player to learn if they're innocent or suspicious
wiki.article.role.detective.attributes:
* If they are innocent, they are friends with you
* If they are suspicious, they are enemies with you
wiki.article.role.detective.extra:
* A suspicious aura makes the player with the aura register as suspicious to you
* An innocent aura makes the player with the aura register as innocent to you
wiki.article.role.lookout.guide:
- At night, select a player to find out who visits them

_For Example_
- If you select @1 on the night they die, and @2 visited them then it's likely @2 killed them.

You should tell the town the information you get daily.
wiki.article.role.lookout.abilities: * Visit a player to find all other visitors to them
wiki.article.role.lookout.extra: * A framer may end up impacting your results using appeared visits
wiki.article.role.spy.guide:
- At night, select a player to be told what seems to happen to them
    - You are told if they are roleblocked, wardblocked, silenced, transported, possessed, or protected from an attack
- Each night you will passively learn information:
    - You always learn who the mafia visited
    - If there are any cultists alive you learn more information:
        - Whether or not the cult could have attempted to convert or kill that night
        - How many cultists are alive when night ends

 You should tell the town the information you get daily
wiki.article.role.spy.abilities:
* You are told what players are visited by mafia members, and are told their name multiple times if that player is visited multiple times
* If there are any cultists alive then you are told how many cultists are alive
* If there are cultists alive then you are told whether or not the cult could have attempted to convert or kill tonight
* Visit a player to learn if they were told that they were transported, silenced, roleblocked, wardblocked, possessed, or protected
wiki.article.role.spy.attributes: * Your bug tells you when your target receives a message saying they are silenced, roleblocked, wardblocked, protected, possessed, or transported
wiki.article.role.spy.extra:
* If you are blocked, you aren't told mafia visits, cultist count, weather or not cult can convert, or the bug information
* Your bug can be messed with by a hypnotist, if a hypnotist sends the player you bug a message, your bug catches that message
wiki.article.role.tracker.guide:
- At night select a player to find out who they visited

_For example_
- If you select @5 and they visited @10 on the night @10 died, @5 might have attacked @10

 You should tell the town the information you get daily.
wiki.article.role.tracker.abilities: * Visit a player to see who they visit
wiki.article.role.tracker.extra: * Appeared visits can make you get false information, _for example_ a Framer makes their target player appear to visit someone else (See appeared visits)
wiki.article.role.philosopher.guide:
- At night, select 2 players and learn if they are friends or enemies
    - If they're friends, it is possible for both of them to win in the same game

_For example_
- A jester is friends with a detective, because they can both win in the same game
- A Doctor is enemies with a godfather because they need the other person to lose in order to win
- A hypnotist is enemies with a disciple because they can't win together

 You should tell the town the information you get daily.
wiki.article.role.philosopher.abilities: * Visit 2 players to learn if they are friends or enemies
wiki.article.role.philosopher.attributes:
* If 2 players are friends they can win together
* If 2 players are enemies they can't win together
wiki.article.role.philosopher.extra:
* Players with a suspicious aura register as enemies with everyone
* Players with an innocent aura register as friends with everyone
- If both a suspicious aura and innocent aura are involved in your investigation, they will be enemies. A godfather and a player who is framed by a framer are enemies
wiki.article.role.psychic.guide:
- You receive a vision every night
    - On even nights, the vision lists 2 players. At least one of them is a townie
    - On odd nights, the vision will list three players. At least one of them is not a townie

You should tell the town the information you get daily.
wiki.article.role.psychic.abilities:
* Get an evil vision on odd nights
* Get a good vision on even nights
wiki.article.role.psychic.attributes:
* Evil visions list three players, at least one of them does not exclusively win with town
* Good visions list 2 players, at least one of them exclusively wins with town
- You don't get a vision if you are blocked or dead
wiki.article.role.psychic.extra:
* If there aren't enough evil or good players to have a vision, the ability fails
* You can not be listed in your own vision
* You do not visit the players in your vision
* Players with a suspicious aura can't be listed in your good vision
* Players with an innocent aura can't be listed in your evil vision
- Your visions don't depend on visits, you still get visions while dead
wiki.article.role.auditor.guide:
- At night, choose an outline from the list
    - You are told 2 roles, one of those roles were assigned to a player from that outline
    - You visit the player who was assigned that role, but you are not told who that player is

_For Example_
- You choose the outline "Town Killing" and are told that a vigilante or a veteran generated from that outline, and you are attacked by the veteran
wiki.article.role.auditor.abilities:
- Choose an outline
    - You are told what role was generated from that outline and one other random role
    - You visit the player who was assigned the role from the outline
wiki.article.role.auditor.attributes:
- You are not told who the player with the role is
- The random role you are told is from the outline you chose
- If the outline you choose could only generate either 1 or 2 roles, then you are only told 1 role, otherwise you are told 2 roles
wiki.article.role.auditor.extra:
- Your ability works independently of your visits, Your visit getting transported or getting possessed doesn't usually impact your ability
    - If you are blocked, you don't get results, but you can select that outline again
- It is possible for you to visit dead players
wiki.article.role.snoop.guide:
- At night, select a player. You are either told that they are a townie, or that you can't tell if they are a townie
    - You can't tell what your target was if:
        - They aren't a townie
        - You were visited by anyone at all
        - They have a suspicious aura

    - Otherwise, you are told they are a townie
wiki.article.role.snoop.abilities:
- Visit a player to search them
    - If your target is a exclusively wins with town, and you are not visited by anyone, you are told they are a townie
wiki.article.role.snoop.attributes: - If your target has a suspicious aura, your results will be inconclusive
wiki.article.role.snoop.extra: - innocent aura doesn't effect your results
wiki.article.role.gossip.guide:
- At night, select a player. You are told if they visited an enemy of them
- If they visited a friend, or nobody, they did not visit an enemy
wiki.article.role.gossip.abilities:
- Visit a player to eavesdrop on
    - If your target visited an enemy to them, you are told so
wiki.article.role.gossip.attributes: - If any of your targets targets have a suspicious aura, then you are told they visited an enemy
wiki.article.role.gossip.extra:
- Suspicious aura overrides innocent aura
- If your target visits multiple other players, you learn if at least one of them is an enemy with your target
- False appeared visits can mess with your results
- Your target having an aura does not mess with the results, however, their targets having an aura does
wiki.article.role.flowerGirl.guide:
- At night, you are told how many players are non town from the players who voted guilty during any of the trials today
- If any player has innocent aura, they are counted as town
- If any player has suspicious aura, they are counted as non town
wiki.article.role.flowerGirl.abilities:
- At night, you are told how many players are non town from the players who voted guilty today
- If you are blocked, you aren't told anything
- Your ability doesn't depend on visits
wiki.article.role.flowerGirl.attributes:
- Your ability still works when dead
- A suspicious aura makes a player register as non town
- An innocent aura makes a player register as town
- A suspicious aura overwrites innocent aura to the Flower Girl
wiki.article.role.flowerGirl.extra: - A player is counted as a townie if they exclusively win with town. so a jester is non town, and a marionette is non town
wiki.article.role.doctor.guide:
- At night, select a player to protect
    - Whoever you protect doesn't die if they're attacked
    - You and the player you protected are both told if they are attacked
- You can select yourself to protect yourself once per game
- If your target is attacked by a protection-piercing attack they still die
- You can't select anyone night 1

You should try to protect people you think are townies who will be attacked.
wiki.article.role.doctor.abilities:
* Visit a player to protect for the night
* You can't select a player night 1
wiki.article.role.doctor.attributes: * If you visit yourself, you lose the ability to select yourself
wiki.article.role.doctor.extra:
* You are told if your target is attacked
* Your target is told they are protected only if they get attacked
wiki.article.role.bodyguard.guide:
- Select a player to protect each night
    - If the player you protect is attacked, you are attacked instead, and you attack the attacker back
 - You can't select anyone night 1
- You can target yourself once per game

- You should try to protect people you think are townies who will be attacked.
wiki.article.role.bodyguard.abilities:
* Visit another player
    * When any players visit your target with an attacking visit, they are redirected into visiting and attacking you
    * If you redirect an attackers visit into yourself, you attack all attackers
* Visit yourself
    * You protect yourself tonight
    * You don't redirect any attacks
    * You lose the ability to select yourself
wiki.article.role.bodyguard.attributes: * You have an indirect armor-piercing attack
wiki.article.role.bodyguard.extra:
* You will be told if your target is attacked
* Your target is told that they were protected if they were attacked
* If your target is attacked by multiple visits, you will attack back for each visit
wiki.article.role.cop.guide:
- At night, select a player to protect
 - You attack one random other player who visits your target
- You can't use your ability night 1

 You should try to protect people you think are townies who will be attacked. You could easily accidentally kill townies, so you should try to make sure no other townies visit the player you protect.
wiki.article.role.cop.abilities:
* Visit a player to protect for the night
* Attack a random visitor of the player you protect
wiki.article.role.cop.attributes:
* Your attack prioritizes a random evil player over players who exclusively win with town
* You can't attack yourself
wiki.article.role.cop.extra:
* You can't select yourself
* You are told if your target is attacked
* Your target is only be told that they are protected if they are attacked
* Your attack is indirect and basic
* You can't attack dead players
wiki.article.role.bouncer.guide:
- At night, select a player to ward them, stopping almost all abilities from working on them.

_For Example_
- A godfather attempts to kill @11 but you ward @11, so the godfathers is wardblocked and doesn't kill @11

You should try to select people you think are townies who you want to keep alive.
wiki.article.role.bouncer.abilities:
* Visit a player to ward them
    - Everyone visitor to your target has their visits erased, and receives a chat message informing them that they are wardblocked
wiki.article.role.bouncer.attributes: * Your target isn't told they are warded
wiki.article.role.bouncer.extra:
* You can't select yourself
* You are immune to roleblocks, wardblocks, and possession
wiki.article.role.engineer.guide:
Set a trap on a player, protecting them and killing attackers
- It takes one night for the trap to be ready, it is not ready on the first night
- When the trap is ready, you can set it on a player

The trap triggers if anyone visits the player with the trap on them
- You attack any players who attack the trapped player
- You are be told the role of every visitor to the trapped player
- The trap will be dismantled the next night after it triggers
- If you dismantle the trap manually, you can use it the next night
wiki.article.role.engineer.abilities:
* While the trap is dismantled
    * You can't select anyone
    * If you aren't blocked, the trap will become ready the next night
* While the trap is ready
    * Visit a player to set the trap
    * You can't select yourself
* While the trap is set
    * The player with the trap on them is protected
    * If a player visits the player with the trap, the trap triggers
    * Visit anyone to manually dismantle the trap
    * You can only select yourself
* When the trap triggers
    * You are told the roles of the players who visited the trapped player
    * You indirectly attack all players attacking the trapped player
    * The trap dismantles, the next night you wait again
wiki.article.role.engineer.attributes:
* You can only have one trap set at a time
* The trap still triggers even if you are blocked or dead
* When your trap is triggered, you are told which roles visited the trapped player, even if the players with those roles didn't attack the trapped player
* The trap still triggers even if none of the trapped players visitors are attackers
* The trap only attacks attackers to the trapped player
* You have an indirect, armor-piercing attack
* You are told the state of your trap at the start of night, and again at the end of night, even while dead.
wiki.article.role.engineer.extra:
* When the player with the trap is attacked, you are told they are attacked, and they are told they are protected
* You can't activate your own trap
* If you stop being the engineer your trap disappears
* Your role still works while dead, but you can't select anyone to visit them
wiki.article.role.armorsmith.guide:
- At night, select yourself to open shop up to 2 times per game
    - You and all visitors to you are protected for the night
    - One random visitor to you is given temporary armor, they have protected defense until they are attacked, when they are attacked, armor breaks.
wiki.article.role.armorsmith.abilities:
* Visit anyone to open shop
    * You and all visitors to you are protected
    * One random visitor to you is given temporary armor, which gives them protected defense until they are attacked, in which case it breaks
wiki.article.role.armorsmith.attributes:
* You have only 2 uses of your ability
* Players with temporary armor are told when their armor breaks, but not when they gain it
* You are not told who has temporary armor
* You open shop if you visit anyone, so possession can force you to open shop, but blocking can stop you from opening shop
wiki.article.role.armorsmith.extra:
* Your target is told they are protected if they get attacked
* You can't select anyone other than yourself
wiki.article.role.steward.guide:
- At night, choose a role to protect
    - Everyone with this role is protected from attacks
    - You are told if anyone with this role is attacked
    - You can't protect the same role twice in a row
    - You can't protect Steward more than once per game
wiki.article.role.steward.abilities:
* Choose a role to protect
    * Everyone with this role is protected
    * You are told if anyone with this role is attacked, and they are told they are protected
wiki.article.role.steward.attributes:
* You can't protect the same role two nights in a row
* You can't protect your own role more than once
* Your ability does nothing if you are blocked, or dead
wiki.article.role.steward.extra: You do not visit the roles you protect
wiki.article.role.escort.guide:
- At night, select a player to roleblock them, stopping them from using their ability
- Your target is told they were roleblocked

_For example_
- An escort selects the godfather, so the godfather can't kill anyone, and nobody dies

You should try to choose evil players, especially the ones with powerful abilities
wiki.article.role.escort.abilities: * Visit a player to roleblock them
wiki.article.role.escort.attributes:
* You can't be roleblocked
* Your target is told when they are roleblocked, even if they are immune to being roleblocked
wiki.article.role.escort.extra: * When someone is roleblocked, their visits are wiped, so they don't visit anyone
wiki.article.role.medium.guide:
- You can message the dead and other mediums at night
- After you die, you can choose to haunt a living player 2 times
    - The player you haunt will be able to speak with the dead

 On the first night, you should attempt to contact any other possible mediums to learn if there are any. You should try to find information from other players and tell the town what dead players think about the game.
wiki.article.role.medium.abilities:
* At night, you can read and send messages in the dead chat group
* While dead, choose a living player during the day to haunt at night, putting that player in the haunt chat group during the night.
wiki.article.role.medium.extra:
* While in jail, you can read from dead chat group, but you can't send to it. Haunted players can read AND send to dead chat, even if in jail
* While any dead medium haunts any living player, all dead mediums, haunted players, and dead players are together in the dead chat group
* Each medium can do 2 haunts, so 2 mediums can do four haunts
wiki.article.role.retributionist.guide:
- At night, Select a dead townie to possess them, forcing them to use their ability on a living player
- You can only possess dead players who's grave has a town role on it
- You can possess the same player up to 2 times
wiki.article.role.retributionist.abiliti:
- Visit 2 players
    - The first player has their first visit changed to the second player you visit
- You can only select certain players
    - The first player you select must be a dead player with a town role on their grave
    - The second player you select must be any living player
wiki.article.role.retributionist.attribu:
* The first player you visit is told that they were possessed or immune to possession
* You are told all night information messages that your target gets told
* You can't select a dead player who you have previously possessed more than once
wiki.article.role.retributionist.extra:
* You are immune to getting roleblocked or possessed
* You can force your target to visit any living player
* If you don't successfully possess the player you select, you can select them again
* All your visits except the first are cleared after you change your targets visits
    * A tracker will only see you visit your first target
wiki.article.role.journalist.guide:
- Each day, choose a player to interview that night
    - You can speak with your interviewee at night, and they aren't told who you are
- You make a journal that is posted at the start of each day
    - The journal is anonymous, so if you don't write who you are, nobody would know who you are
    - Your journal won't be posted if you are silenced or blocked

 You should ask what peoples roles are during an interview, they should tell you because they know you're a journalist. If they don't tell you their role, they are likely evil. You should write who you think is evil in your journal so it is posted and everyone knows.
wiki.article.role.journalist.abilities:
* Your journal is posted publicly every obituary while you alive if it is set to public
* During the day you may choose a player to interview that night
wiki.article.role.journalist.attributes:
*  You can talk with the player you interview at night
* Your journal is posted anonymously, nobody knows who wrote it
* Players you interview do not see your name on your messages, instead, the messages you send appear to be from the journalist.
wiki.article.role.journalist.extra:
* If there is more than one Journalist with a public journal, the journals are posted in player order
* Your journal does not get posted if you are silenced or blocked
* If you interview a cultist or mafia member, their teammates are told that the player is being interviewed
wiki.article.role.vigilante.guide:
- At night, select a player to attack
- If you kill a townie, you will commit suicide on the following night (and probably cause town to lose)
- You have three bullets
- You can't shoot on night one

 If you attack someone and they survive it is likely that they were either protected by a protective role, or they are a role that is armored. Most roles that are armored are evil.
wiki.article.role.vigilante.abilities:
* Visit a player to attack and spend a bullet
* If you kill a townie you will commit suicide on the following night
* You have three bullets
wiki.article.role.vigilante.attributes:
* If your attack overpowers a player who exclusively wins with towns defense and they die, you commit suicide on the following night
* When it is night one, when you have 0 bullets left, when you are going to commit suicide, or when you have already committed suicide, you can not select or attack anyone
wiki.article.role.vigilante.extra:
* You only have a basic attack
* Even while dead, killing someone requires and spends a bullet (such as when you get possessed)
wiki.article.role.rabbleRouser.guide:
- If a RabbleRouser is alive in the game, everyone can vote using the pitchfork menu
- If 2/3rds of town aligned players vote the same player, that player is killed
- This ability can be used up to 3 times
- The pitchfork menu stays open at all times, regardless of weather or not it can be used
wiki.article.role.rabbleRouser.abilities:
- You and all other RabbleRousers are told when the pitchfork attacks someone, or if the attacked player has defense and survive
- You don't visit due to your ability
- The pitchfork can only be used to kill someone up to 3 times
wiki.article.role.rabbleRouser.attribute:
- Anyone who doesn't exclusively win with town is not counted as a voter for the pitchfork
- The attack is indirect and protection piercing
wiki.article.role.rabbleRouser.extra:
- The pitchfork menu stays available at all times
   - Even if all RabbleRousers are dead
    - Even if there is no rabbleRouser
    - Even if all three uses are consumed
- Multiple rabbleRousers does not mean multiple attacks or more uses. There is a maximum of 3 uses and a maximum of 1 attack per night
wiki.article.role.veteran.guide:
- At night, you can select yourself to gain protected defense for the night and rampage yourself, attacking everyone who visits you
- You can only use your ability three times
- You can't use your ability on night 1
* You should try to trick evil players into visiting you, so you can block the attack and kill them. Try to avoid killing unnecessary townies.
* There can only be one veteran in a game.
wiki.article.role.veteran.abilities:
* Select yourself
    - rampage yourself
    - gain protected defense for the night
wiki.article.role.veteran.attributes:
* You only have three uses of your ability
* You are told when a visitor is attacked by your rampage
* You have an indirect, armor-piercing attack
- You can't use your ability night 1
wiki.article.role.veteran.extra:
* While you have 0 uses left, you can not select yourself
* You are immune to getting roleblocked and getting possessed
* Players who visit you while your ability is active are told they are attacked by a veteran
* When you select yourself, you don't visit yourself
* You can't attack dead players
wiki.article.role.marksman.guide:
- Each night, choose up to three players to mark, and select up to three players to camp
    - If a marked player visits a camped player, you attack the marked player
- You can't do anything on the first night
- If you kill a townie, you can't use your ability again
- You should try to mark players who act suspicious, and camp players that they would only visit if they're evil
wiki.article.role.marksman.abilities:
* Choose to mark up to 3 players
* Select up to 3 players, if you have nobody marked, you can't select anyone
    - If a marked player visits any of your targets, you attack them
wiki.article.role.marksman.attributes:
* You can't mark or select to camp on night 1
* If you kill a player who exclusively wins with town, you can't mark or select again
* You have an indirect, basic attack
wiki.article.role.marksman.extra:
* You can't select to camp yourself
- You only visit the players you select, not the players you mark, even if you attack the marked players
wiki.article.role.deputy.guide:
- Once per game, you can shoot a player during the day
- If you kill a townie, you instantly leave town
- If you kill someone, everyone is told that a deputy shot someone
- If the player you shoot survives your attack, only the player you attacked is told
- You can only shoot during discussion or nomination

If you attack someone and they survive it is likely that they are a role that is armored. Most roles that are armored are evil.
wiki.article.role.deputy.abilities: * Once per game, during the discussion or nomination phase after day 1, you may choose a player to attack.
wiki.article.role.deputy.attributes:
* If the player you attack has defense, they are told they were attacked by a deputy
* When you kill someone, everyone is told a deputy shot someone
* If you kill a player who exclusively wins with town, you instantly leave town
wiki.article.role.deputy.extra:
* You only have a basic attack
* You can not attack day 1
wiki.article.role.godfather.guide:
- At night, select a player to attack
- You can't attack night 1
- Choose a backup to attack for you if you are blocked

 You should try to kill townies who are likely to stop you from winning or have powerful abilities, but be careful about town protective roles.
wiki.article.role.godfather.abilities:
* Visit a player to attack
* Choose another living mafia member to be your backup at any time
* While you are blocked, the backup will attack the first player they visit
wiki.article.role.godfather.attributes:
* When you are blocked, the mafia is told that the backup attacks for you
- Neither you or the backup can select or attack night 1
wiki.article.role.godfather.extra:
* You only have a basic attack
* When the Godfather dies, their current backup becomes the Godfather
* You can not select other mafia members
wiki.article.role.retrainer.guide:
- At night, select a player to attack
- You can't attack night 1
- Choose a backup to attack for you if you are blocked
- 2 times per game, retrain the backup, changing their role to a different mafia support role

 You should try to kill townies who are likely to stop you from winning or have powerful abilities, but be careful about town protective roles.
wiki.article.role.retrainer.abilities:
* Visit a player to attack
* Choose another living mafia member to be your backup at any time
* While you are blocked, the backup will attack the first player they visit
- 2 times per game, you can choose to retrain, changing the role of the backup player to a different mafia support role
wiki.article.role.retrainer.attributes:
* When you are blocked, the mafia is told that the backup attacks for you
- Neither you or the backup can select or attack night 1
- You can only retrain a mafia member when it is not night
- If you try to retrain the backup to the role that they already are, it doesn't work, and doesn't cost an ability
- You can only retrain while it is not night
wiki.article.role.retrainer.extra:
* You only have a basic attack
* When the Retrainer dies, their current backup becomes the Retrainer
* You can not select other mafia members
wiki.article.role.imposter.guide:
- At night, select a player to attack
- You can't attack night 1
- Choose a backup to attack for you if you are blocked
- You can choose what role appears on your grave, giving false information to the town when you die

 You should try to kill townies who are likely to stop you from winning or have powerful abilities, but be careful about town protective roles.
wiki.article.role.imposter.abilities:
* Visit a player to attack
* Choose another living mafia member to be your backup at any time
* While you are blocked, the backup will attack the first player they visit
- At any time while you are alive, choose a role, that role appears on your grave when you die instead of imposter
wiki.article.role.imposter.attributes:
* When you are blocked, the mafia is told that the backup attacks for you
- Neither you or the backup can select or attack night 1
- You have armor defense at all times by default
wiki.article.role.imposter.extra:
* You only have a basic attack
* When the Imposter dies, their current backup becomes the Imposter
* You can not select other mafia members
wiki.article.role.eros.guide:
- At night, either kill a player, or love link 2 players
    - You can't attack night 1
    - Whenever a player who is love linked to another player dies, the other love linked player dies as well
- You have an innocent aura and armor

If you are roleblocked by an escort, it might be a good idea to claim that you were love linked to another mafia member that night. Doing that hides the fact that the eros was roleblocked, and might hide that your eros from that escort.
wiki.article.role.eros.abilities:
- If you chose to kill
    - Visit a player attack
- If you chose to love link
    - Visit 2 players to love link them, if one dies tonight, they do not love link
wiki.article.role.eros.attributes:
- You have a basic attack
- You have armor
- You have an innocent aura
wiki.article.role.eros.extra:
- You can't select mafia members to kill
- You can select mafia members to love link, but not yourself
wiki.article.role.counterfeiter.guide:
- Each night except the first, kill a player
- 3 times per game, you can forge the player you kill, changing their role and albi in their grave
wiki.article.role.counterfeiter.abilitie:
- Visit a player to basic attack them
- If you chose to forge and you have uses left, you forge the player you visit, changing their role and alibi in their grave
wiki.article.role.counterfeiter.attribut:
- You can copy paste chat messages
- If you are blocked, it doesn't cost an ability use, but it does cost a use if the player you attack survives
wiki.article.role.recruiter.guide:
- You may choose to do one of the following
    - Select and attack a player
    - Select a player to recruit into the mafia
        - They are told they are recruited, and that they will win with mafia, but their role doesn't change
        - They are attacked the following night, and every night until they die
        - You have 3 uses of this ability by default
- For every time you successfully kill someone, you can gain one use to your recruit ability
- If a recruiter is randomly generated, a non recruiter mafia member has their role switched to a random town role before the game starts, they never know of this
wiki.article.role.recruiter.abilities:
- You may choose to do one of the following
    - Visit a player to attack them
    - Visit a player to recruit to join the mafia
        - They are told they are recruited, and they now win with mafia, but their role doesn't change
        - They will be indirectly hit with a protection-piercing attack every night by all recruiters until they die, if there are no recruiters they are still attacked
- For every time you successfully kill someone, you can gain one use to your recruit ability
- If a recruiter is randomly generated, a non recruiter mafia member has their role switched to a random town role before the game starts, they never know of this
wiki.article.role.recruiter.attributes:
- The mafia and the recruits are shown who all mafia and recruits are, and their role labels
- Recruiting someone is attack power basic, if a player has defense attempt to recruit, nothing happens
wiki.article.role.recruiter.extra:
- You can't select anybody who is a recruit, or mafia
- A mafia member can't be recruited
- A recruited player can't be recruited again
wiki.article.role.mafioso.guide:
- At night select a player to attack them
- You can't use your ability night 1

You should try to kill townies who are likely to stop you from winning.
wiki.article.role.mafioso.extra: * You can't target other mafia members
wiki.article.role.mafiaKillingWildcard.g:
* Choose a mafia killing role to become that role
    * You become that role when night starts
* You likely can't become a role if someone already has that role (You can't become a role that has exceeded its role limit)
wiki.article.role.mafiaKillingWildcard.a: * Become a role you choose at the start of night

* You can not become a role that is disabled
* You can not become a role that is taken by too many players
wiki.article.role.mafiaKillingWildcard.e:
* If you choose a role that was disabled you stay as the Mafia Killing Wildcard
* You can choose Mafia Killing Wildcard to stay as Mafia Killing Wildcard
* You can't become a role that is at its role limit, for example, you can't become a godfather even if there is already one in the game, even if that godfather is dead
wiki.article.role.madeMan.guide: You have no night time ability besides chatting with the mafia. Try to help the mafia come up with lies and come up with a fake claim.
wiki.article.role.hypnotist.guide:
- At night, select a player to roleblock or hypnotize
- If you roleblock your target, they can not use their ability that night
- You can choose to send a false message to your target, or to not send them the message saying they are roleblocked
wiki.article.role.hypnotist.abilities:
* Visit a player to roleblock and choose a message to show them
    * You can send that they were attempted to be roleblocked
    * You can send that they were attacked but had defense
    * You can send that they were protected by someone
    * You can send that they were transported
    * You can send that they were attempted to be possessed
    * You can send that they are wardblocked
wiki.article.role.hypnotist.attributes:
* You are immune to roleblocks
* You may choose to not roleblock your target
* You can't choose to send no messages
wiki.article.role.hypnotist.extra:
* You can't select other mafia members
* When you roleblock someone, their visits will be cleared
wiki.article.role.consort.guide:
- At night, select a player to roleblock them, stopping them from using their ability
- Your target is told they were roleblocked

_For example_
- A consort selects the vigilante, so the vigilante can't kill anyone, and nobody dies
wiki.article.role.consort.abilities: * Visit a player to roleblock them
wiki.article.role.consort.attributes:
* You can't be roleblocked
* Your target is told when they are roleblocked, even if they are immune to being roleblocked
wiki.article.role.consort.extra:
* When someone is roleblocked, their visits are wiped, so they don't visit anyone
* You can't select other mafia members
wiki.article.role.blackmailer.guide:
- At night, select a player to silence
- The silenced player can't speak during the next day, and they can't vote during the next nomination

You should choose talkative players who might speak out against a mafia member, or players who have information that you want to suppress.
wiki.article.role.blackmailer.abilities: * Visit a player to silence them during the next day
wiki.article.role.blackmailer.attributes:
* Silenced players are forced to forfeit vote during the next day
* Silenced players can not talk in chat or out loud during the entire next day
wiki.article.role.blackmailer.extra:
* The silenced player is no longer be silenced at the start of the next night
* You cannot select other mafia members
wiki.article.role.informant.guide:
- At night, select a player to learn:
    - Their role
    - Who they visited
    - Who visited them
- You can read whispers that were sent to other players

You should communicate the information you get to the rest of the mafia. It is fairly easy to fake claim lookout or tracker.
wiki.article.role.informant.abilities:
* Visit a player to
    * Learn their role
    * Learn who visited them
    * Learn who they visited
* All whispers can be read regardless of whether or not they were sent to you
wiki.article.role.informant.extra: * You can't select other mafia members
wiki.article.role.necromancer.guide: You can select a dead player to possess and force them to visit a player you select. You can only choose to possess dead townies. You can not possess the same player more than twice.
wiki.article.role.necromancer.abilities:
* Visit 2 players to make the first player visit the second player
* The first player you select must appear as a dead player in the graveyard
wiki.article.role.necromancer.attributes:
* The first player you visit is told that they were possessed or immune to possession
* You are told all night information messages that the player you possess gets told
* You can't select a dead player who you have previously possessed
wiki.article.role.necromancer.extra:
* You are immune to getting roleblocked or possessed
* You can force your target to visit any living player
* If you don't successfully possess the player you select, you can select them again
* All your visits except the first are cleared after you change your targets visits
    * A tracker will only see you visit your first target
wiki.article.role.witch.guide:
- At night, possess a player by selecting 2 players
    - The first player you select will be forced to visit the second player you select

_For example_
- You can posses a vigilante to attack another townie by selecting the vigilante first and the townie second
wiki.article.role.witch.abilities: * Visit 2 players to make the first player visit the second player
wiki.article.role.witch.attributes:
* The first player you visit is told that they were possessed or immune to possession
* You are told all night information messages that the player you possess gets told
wiki.article.role.witch.extra:
* You are immune to getting roleblocked and possession
* You can't select other mafia members for your first target, but you can select any living player for your second target
* Your second target gets erased after you change your targets visit, so no other roles can interact with it
    * A tracker will only see you visit your first target
wiki.article.role.mortician.guide:
- At night, select a player to tag them for obscuring
    - A player who is tagged for obscuring gets obscured when they die, erasing their role and alibi from their grave so nobody knows who they are
    - You are told the obscured players role and alibi when they die
- You can only tag three players
wiki.article.role.mortician.abilities:
* Visit a player to tag them for obscuring
* If a player is obscured, that player's role and alibi do not appear in the graveyard
* You are told the role and alibi of the player you obscured when they die.
wiki.article.role.mortician.attributes: * You can only ever tag three players per game
wiki.article.role.mortician.extra:
* If you are roleblocked, it doesn't cost an ability use
* If you visit a jailed player, it doesn't cost an ability use
* You can target other mafia members, but not yourself
wiki.article.role.forger.guide:
- At night, select a player who dies to forge their role and alibi
- Forging a player on the night they die allows you to edit their role and alibi in their grave
- You can use your ability 3 times

You should select the same player as the godfather or mafia killing so your ability actually works.
wiki.article.role.forger.abilities:
* Visit a player to forge their grave only if they die tonight
* If a grave is forged, that player's role and alibi appear to be what you choose
* You are told the original role and alibi of the player you forge
wiki.article.role.forger.attributes:
* You only have 3 uses of your ability
- You can copy paste chat messages
wiki.article.role.forger.extra:
* If you visit a player to attempt to forge them, it costs an ability use, even if they don't die
* If you are blocked, it doesn't cost an ability use
* You can't target other mafia members
wiki.article.role.framer.guide:
- At night, select a player to frame
    - The player you visit will have a suspicious aura (appears to be evil to investigative roles)
- If you select 2 players
    - The first one is given a suspicious aura
